metadata.title: SEBSCC In Situ Nitrate Data

creators.name: University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), School of Fisheries
Ocean Sciences (SFOS), Institute of Marine Science (IMS)

metadata.description: Nitrate data were collected at SEBSCC mooring site 2 in collaboration with physical and biological investigators.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: The purpose of the in situ nitrate data collection was to assess the dynamics of nitrate enrichment processes at the 70m isobath of the SE Bering Sea shelf.  This will provide a relatively long term period of high density measurements that can be compared to physical and biological measurements being collected concurrently.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Continually

Access constraints: All data available one year after collection.

Use constraints: No use constraints after one year of collection other than
giving proper citation to the data origin.

Distribution liability: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
